t: Job 12
Job Replies: The Lord Has Done This
Then*p Job answered and said:
“No*pn doubt you are the people, and*ld wisdom will die with you.
But*ln I have understanding as well as you; I*ld am not inferior to you. Who*ld does not know such things as these?
I*ln am a laughingstock to my friends; I,*ld who called to God and he answered me, a*ld just and blameless man, am a laughingstock.
In*ln the thought of one who is at ease there is contempt for misfortune; it*ld is ready for those whose feet slip.
The*ln tents of robbers are at peace, and*ld those who provoke God are secure, who*ld bring their god in their hand.
“But*pn ask the beasts, and they will teach you; the*ld birds of the heavens, and they will tell you;
or*ln the bushes of the earth, and they will teach you; and*ld the fish of the sea will declare to you.
Who*ln among all these does not know that*ld the hand of the Lord*s has done this?
In*ln his hand is the life of every living thing and*ld the breath of all mankind.
Does*ln not the ear test words as*ld the palate tastes food?
Wisdom*ln is with the aged, and*ld understanding in length of days.
“With*pn God are wisdom and might; he*ld has counsel and understanding.
If*ln he tears down, none can rebuild; if*ld he shuts a man in, none can open.
If*ln he withholds the waters, they dry up; if*ld he sends them out, they overwhelm the land.
With*ln him are strength and sound wisdom; the*ld deceived and the deceiver are his.
He*ln leads counselors away stripped, and*ld judges he makes fools.
He*ln looses the bonds of kings and*ld binds a waistcloth on their hips.
He*ln leads priests away stripped and*ld overthrows the mighty.
He*ln deprives of speech those who are trusted and*ld takes away the discernment of the elders.
He*ln pours contempt on princes and*ld loosens the belt of the strong.
He*ln uncovers the deeps out of darkness and*ld brings deep darkness to light.
He*ln makes nations great, and he destroys them; he*ld enlarges nations, and leads them away.
He*ln takes away understanding from the chiefs of the people of the earth and*ld makes them wander in a trackless waste.
They*ln grope in the dark without light, and*ld he makes them stagger like a drunken man.
